parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To bury along with. From sun and thapto; to inter in company with, i.e. to assimilate spiritually.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Dipping, washing (of a ceremonial character). From baptizo; ablution.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To raise along with. From sun and egeiro; to rouse in company with, i.e. to revivify in resemblance to.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Faith, belief, trust, confidence; fidelity, faithfulness.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Working, action, productive work, activity; in the NT, confined to superhuman activity. From energes; efficiency.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
(a) adj: dead, lifeless, subject to death, mortal, (b) noun: a dead body, a corpse. From an apparently primary nekus; dead.
